titleStmt.title: A Description of the Office of Credit by the use of which none can possibbly sustain loss, but every man may certainly receive great gain and wealth : with a plain demon[s]tration how a man may trade for six times his stock and never be trusted : and that ... there can afterwards no accident happen to cause a deadness or slowness of trade, except warrs, nor need men make any more bad debts : with divers other publick and paivate [sic] conveniences and profits, as also objections hitherto made against it, largely and fully answered.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the order of the Society, for Thomas Rooks,

notesStmt.note: "The Society" by whose order this tract was printed was apparently the "Society governing the Office of Credit," mentioned on p. 3.
Reproduction of original in Columbia University Library.
